content.raw:
The bizarre collection of dependencies in `ign-common` made for a good exercise as I designed `ign-cmake`, because it gave me all sorts of strange edge-cases to test against, as well as a plethora of dependencies to investigate.

But yes, absolutely, I think `ign-common` needs to be broken down into separate projects. In particular, it's pretty weird for plugins to depend on AV or mesh utilities.

I would propose that we move forward with decomposing `ign-common` after we've merged the plugin PRs [[1]](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/59) and [[2]](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/61) as well as migrated to `ignition-cmake` [[3]](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/69). I think the PR to make AV dependencies optional [[4]](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/55) would be better solved by this decomposition, and I expect the fprintf PR [[5]](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/70) will be merged long before [1], [2], or [3].
